article1.title: Purpose
article1.content: These Terms of Sale govern the private chauffeur transportation services offered by Green Road Services.

article2.title: Services Offered
article2.content: Green Road Services offers VTC transportation services including: airport and train station transfers, hourly hire, Champagne tours, and event transportation (weddings, seminars, etc.).

article3.title: Booking
article3.content: Bookings are made via the website or by phone. They are confirmed after validation by our team and receipt of payment. A confirmation email is sent to the customer.

article4.title: Rates
article4.content: Rates are shown in euros including all taxes. They include the vehicle, driver, fuel, and tolls. Any additional waiting time beyond 15 minutes will be charged at €1/minute.

article5.title: Payment
article5.content: Payment is made online by credit card via our secure Stripe platform. Full payment is required to confirm the booking.

article6.title: Cancellation and Refund
article6.content: The cancellation conditions are as follows:
article6.rule1: Cancellation more than 5 hours before the ride: full refund
article6.rule2: Cancellation less than 5 hours before the ride: 30% fee, 70% refund

article7.title: Liability
article7.content: Green Road Services is insured for passenger transportation. Our liability is limited to proven direct damages. We are not responsible for delays due to exceptional circumstances (traffic jams, weather conditions, etc.).

article8.title: Luggage
article8.content: Standard luggage transportation is included in the price. For bulky luggage or specific equipment transport, please contact us in advance.

article9.title: Complaints
article9.content: Any complaint must be sent by email to contact.greenroadservices@gmail.com within 7 days of the service. We commit to responding within 48 hours.

article10.title: Applicable Law
article10.content: These Terms of Sale are subject to French law. In case of dispute, an amicable solution will be sought before any legal action. Failing that, the courts of Reims will have jurisdiction.
